page.title: 02Bickerstaffe Parish Church
page.content: The only church in the area is Bickerstaffe Parish Church, named Holy Trinity. The church was built in 1843 in a joint deal between Lord Derby and the local parishoners. Lord Derby donated the stone on condition that the parishoners collected and moved it. The North Aisle is mid-Victorian built about 1870, and the vestry is early 20th century. The builting is of historical interest not only because it shows several periods of building but more importantly because of it's roof structure. The church must be one of the first churches to be built with a laminated roof structure which only became popular in 1900. The Victorian section of the church was built with a straight wood structure.
